summary: This is an FBI Miami Division internal request form to the Document Conversion Laboratory (DocLab) to scan and process telephone records related to the obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez. The document reveals Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager, attempted to sell an address book believed to contain names of additional underage victims rather than surrender it to authorities.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein; subject of obstruction of justice case
persons.context: The subject of the FBI's obstruction of justice investigation. He came into possession of an address book with names and numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein and attempted to sell it.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: Identified as the individual whose former house manager, Alfredo Rodriguez, possessed an address book believed to contain information on his underage victims.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FBI opens obstruction case against Rodriguez
events.description: Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: FBI requests document conversion for telephone records
events.description: The FBI Miami Division submits a formal request to the Document Conversion Laboratory to scan and process telephone records related to the Rodriguez/Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager, came into possession of an address book containing names and telephone numbers of what are believed to be additional, previously unknown underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

Rodriguez attempted to sell this address book rather than turn it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas, leading to an FBI obstruction of justice case against him opened in October 2009.
The FBI is processing telephone records (target number 702-743-0620) from the address book, believed to belong to Epstein, his associates, or potential underage victims.
The document is an internal FBI request to scan and digitize these records for incorporation into the Bureau's Telephone Application (TA) investigative database.
